The Dorgeshuun crossbow is a crossbow requiring level 28 Ranged to equip. It is often used to train Ranged at low to medium levels, due to it having several advantages over similar crossbows with the same level requirements.

It has an attack speed that is one tick faster than most other crossbows, and it is able to fire bone bolts, which are significantly cheaper than most other ammunition of similar strength. The fact it is a crossbow also gives it an advantage over shortbows, allowing the use of the shield slot for defensive or offensive purposes.

It can be bought from Nardok in the Dorgeshuun Mines after the completion of The Lost Tribe quest. Completion of this quest is not required to equip it, however, meaning it can be purchased from other players and used without completing this quest. It can fire metal bolts up to iron, except silver bolts, and is the only crossbow that can use bone bolts. Note, however, that bolts containing unique tips and their (e) variants are not able to be fired from it.

This crossbow is the only one-handed crossbow with an attack speed of 5. This makes it 1 tick faster than all other crossbows, with the exception of the hunters' crossbow, which has an attack speed of 4. Weighing less than 2.5kg, it is also the lightest crossbow in the game, making it ideal to use along with the mith grapple when conservation of run energy is necessary, such as in the Hallowed Sepulchre.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Crossbow

A player performs the Dorgeshuun crossbow's special attack, Snipe.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

The Dorgeshuun crossbow has a special attack, Snipe, (75%) which will never miss as long as you weren't the last one to attack the target[1], and lowers the target's Defence by the amount of damage dealt, similar to the Bandos godsword's and bone dagger's special attacks. (Note that while the special attack skips the accuracy roll, it is still possible to "hit" a 0 on a successful attack.)

The special attack requires completion of the quest Death to the Dorgeshuun.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 July 2021
(update)

The weapon's position on female players has been adjusted so that they appear to be equipped properly.

10 December 2014
(update)

The item was renamed from "Dorgeshuun c'bow" to "Dorgeshuun crossbow".

References[edit | edit source]

  1. â†‘ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 11 June 2019. (Archived from the original on 29 July 2020.) Mod Ash: "[Does the Dorgeshuun crossbow's spec reduce the target's defence level even if it's not an "unsuspecting target"? Also, what is an unsuspecting target?] If the accuracy roll is passed, yes. The definition of "unsuspecting target" is "target has not been hit before" OR "target was last hit by someone other than me"."

[[File:Dorgeshuun crossbow detail.png|left|120px]]
The '''Dorgeshuun crossbow''' is a crossbow requiring level 28 [[Ranged]] to equip. It is often used to train [[Ranged]] at low to medium levels, due to it having several advantages over similar [[crossbow (weapon)|crossbow]]s with the same level requirements.

It has an attack speed that is one [[tick]] faster than most other crossbows, and it is able to fire [[bone bolt]]s, which are significantly cheaper than most other ammunition of similar strength. The fact it is a crossbow also gives it an advantage over [[shortbow]]s, allowing the use of the [[shield slot]] for defensive or offensive purposes.

It can be bought from [[Nardok]] in the Dorgeshuun Mines after the completion of [[The Lost Tribe]] quest. Completion of this quest is not required to equip it, however, meaning it can be purchased from other players and used without completing this quest. It can fire metal [[bolts]] up to iron, except [[silver bolts]], and is the only crossbow that can use [[bone bolt]]s. Note, however, that bolts containing unique tips and their (e) variants are not able to be fired from it.

This crossbow is the only one-handed [[crossbow (weapon)|crossbow]] with an [[attack speed]] of 5. This makes it 1 [[tick]] faster than all other crossbows, with the exception of the [[hunters' crossbow]], which has an attack speed of 4. Weighing less than 2.5kg, it is also the lightest crossbow in the game, making it ideal to use along with the [[mith grapple]] when conservation of [[run energy]] is necessary, such as in the [[Hallowed Sepulchre]].

[[File:Snipe.gif|thumb|250px|A player performs the Dorgeshuun crossbow's special attack, ''Snipe''.]]

==Special attack==
The Dorgeshuun crossbow has a [[special attack]], ''Snipe'', (75%) which will never miss as long as you weren't the last one to attack the target{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1138455869358837764|date=11 June 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/k1XmF|archivedate=29 July 2020|quote=[Does the Dorgeshuun crossbow's spec reduce the target's defence level even if it's not an "unsuspecting target"? Also, what is an unsuspecting target?] If the accuracy roll is passed, yes. The definition of "unsuspecting target" is "target has not been hit before" OR "target was last hit by someone other than me".}}, and lowers the target's [[Defence]] by the amount of damage dealt, similar to the [[Bandos godsword]]'s and [[bone dagger]]'s special attacks. (Note that while the special attack skips the accuracy roll, it is still possible to "hit" a 0 on a successful attack.)

The special attack requires completion of the [[quest]] [[Death to the Dorgeshuun]].
